author: {'steamid': '76561198147395114', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 9, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9, 'last_played': 1529199896}
review: As someone who was part of the game from alpha build, it has become exponentially better overtime. The game before was vert confusing and didn't make sense and the core mechanics were lacking. After a lot of time and effort from the developers the game has come a long way, It's a lot more vibrant and user friendly, definitely worth checking out and playing with friends.

author: {'steamid': '76561198258422208', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 475, 'playtime_forever': 385, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 380, 'last_played': 1554085651}
review:
This game is awesome!!!
It would be better played in groups as the waves can get intense.
The graphics and modelling is on point.
The developers are active and always listening to feedback.
If you like a game with a unique look and fun to play with friends i recommend this.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067418239', 'num_games_owned': 2299, 'num_reviews': 104, 'playtime_forever': 34, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23, 'last_played': 1529276252}
review:
dont wanna hate the devs, they seem pationate,
but my experience was playing 1 offline game becuase i couldnt find players and "survivors" and "Molotov" being spelt wrong, (once again, no offense if the devs language isnt natively english, but it was still annoying) and those molotovs didnt have a sound. the game feels quite weird, just somethings not quite right, the way you move and doors open, texture glitches about.

imo im willing to put up with crap in early access but i feel you should of kept this of steam for another month or two while you get the game to a decent standard. good luck to your future and i hope its good though!

author: {'steamid': '76561198255025204', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 42, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 42, 'last_played': 1516553582}
review:
Ok so first it took me forever to figure out how to get a game started seeing as how the servers are not very populated right now it takes forever to get a group game going. so after clicking the public button off and starting a solo game i came to the conculison that i still had no idea what to do. after dying a few time and figureing out that you need to activate a beacon for the chopper to come and find you it came down to could you survive the time limit with no supplies and the answer is no...no you cant you make it about 45 secs before evac and you die. That led to having to run around looking for med supplies so you can survive the time. I'm not sure if players can heal other players or not but team buliding will be a big aspect to this game as well as not trusting who is with you.

In conclusion the game has some great aspects to it liking making you collect supplies to survive while you wait so the infection doesnt take hold. Once more people jump on board with this game the challege is going to increase, with that said i can see alot of people being turned off to this game by PvP kills and your decreaseing health bar running at same time. This game has alot of potential and cant wait to see where it goes

author: {'steamid': '76561198443918247', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 19, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 19, 'last_played': 1516550394}
review:
This game is the biggest waste of 14 dollars. if you are going to release a pre alpha you release it for free and build off the community suggestions. your zombies all of a sudden go god mode and are like the flash. when they walk normally their speed to the animation is high and they look glitched out. in my 20 minutes of playing i managed to find 20 assests that were just sloppily placed and left. i picked up a knife and had no way to equip it. MY health kept draining and im assuming it because of the fog but the gas mask wasnt usable so good luck on that one. i switched threw all the servers and it looks like im the only one that bought the game because it says only 1 person is on on all the servers and you need 15 to start a match unless you go in by yourself. none of the options on the main menu work. 

you should have greenlighted this game built it like that got backers and worked that way instead of trying to sell off some "finished game" on an advertisement campaign. 

thank you for refund

author: {'steamid': '76561198060612517', 'num_games_owned': 315, 'num_reviews': 106, 'playtime_forever': 105, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 105, 'last_played': 1515973271}

author: {'steamid': '76561198018068948', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 20, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20, 'last_played': 1516533307}
review:
Game won't load in solo or otherwise. Not sure if this is an Australia-specific issue but USD$15 seems too much for a loading screen and a settings page.

21/01/2018 - Tried again this morning and still unable to play. The game reports that there are 2 players in my region and I appear to be stuck waiting for at least 15 players before the game can begin.

21/01/2018 - Tried a third time this evening. If you click the public (green) button before hitting the start button, you can launch a solo game. Doesn't seem to work if you hit start before toggling the public setting. And. Wow. I actually had a higher opinion of the game when I was stuck on the loading screen. If you climb to the top of a hill and look out at the horizon, you see... nothing. There is a thick "fog" that prevents you from seeing anything further than your immediate surroundings. Shortly after descending the hill I was attacked by a zombie that took 2 swings at me and then disappeared. Walking further into the fog I eventually found 2 houses which contained several items that were scattered across the floors at even intervals as if the house floor was built out of very large squares of floor that could only hold 1 item. Some of the items were consumable but didn't seem to have any real purpose. At this point, the game is more like a tech demo than an actual game.
